thread.title: New species of deadly funnel-web spider discovered lurking in the outback - and it's terrifying
thread.title_full: New species of deadly funnel-web spider discovered lurking in the outback - and it's terrifying - Mirror Online

author: Jeff Parsons
title: New species of deadly funnel-web spider discovered lurking in the outback - and it's terrifying
text:
Just when you thought it was safe to go back into the attic, scientists have discovered a brand new species of the deadly funnel-web spider .
Spider experts came across the new creepy-crawly in the Booderee National Park on the New South Wales coast.
It was buried down inside a lair in the depths of a rotting log and had probably been in there for up to 30 years.
"It's remarkable that we have found this other species," said Dr Thomas Wallenius, from The Australian National University who discovered the new spider.
"It shows we still have a lot to learn about what's out there in the bush.
ANU
"They build a silk-lined burrow inside the hollow log which can be up to two metres long. She had probably been living in there for 25 to 30 years."
Measuring an astonishing 50-millimeters across, the eight-legged critter is from the tree-dwelling genus Hadronyche, not the ground-dwelling genus Atrax.
ANU
ANU
But it's just as deadly.
Australian Funnel-web spider bites have caused 13 recorded deaths - although none of these have occurred since the development of an antivenom in 1981.
